details.description: In 2011 Cavalier Wool Holdings Limited applied for authorisation to acquire control of New Zealand Wool Services Limited’s wool scouring business. The Commission authorised this application on  9 June 2011. An interested party, Godfrey Hirst New Zealand Limited, appealed the Commission’s decision (Decision 725) to the High Court. The High Court upheld Decision 725 on 23 November 2011.

details.description: In 2014 Cavalier Wool Holdings Limited applied for authorisation to acquire control of New Zealand Wool Services Limited’s wool scouring business. The application related to the same assets that were the subject of an authorisation that did not proceed in 2011. The Commission authorised the application on 12 November 2015. An interested party, Godfrey Hirst New Zealand Limited, appealed the Commission’s decision ([2015] NZCC 31) to the High Court and subsequently the Court of Appeal. The High Court and Court of Appeal upheld [2015] NZCC 31 on 13 June 2016 and 30 November 2016 respectively.

case_details.parties: Cavalier Wool Holdings Limited; New Zealand Wool Services International Limited

details.description: In 2016 NZME Limited and Fairfax New Zealand Limited sought clearance or authorisation to merge their respective New Zealand operations. The Commission declined to grant authorisation on 2 May 2017. The parties appealed the Commissions decision ([2017] NZCC 8) to the High Court and subsequently the Court of Appeal. The High Court upheld the decision on 18 December 2017. The matter was heard by the Court of Appeal in June 2018.

details.description: We received a clearance application in November 2017 from MYOB Group Limited (MYOB) to acquire the Accountants Group business of Reckon Limited (Reckon). MYOB is a limited liability company incorporated in Australia and listed on the Australian Securities Exchange. MYOB provides software solutions to businesses and accounting practices in New Zealand and Australia. MYOB operates through three divisions, namely Accounting Practices, SME, and Enterprise. MYOB Group Limited withdrew its application to acquire the Accountants Group business of Reckon Limited (Reckon) on 31 May 2018.
